rules.natural: If the failure is logged, then it is documented.
Provided that the researcher consumes a snack, the researcher becomes distracted.
Either the researcher consumes a snack, or if the prototype uses alloy, the material is lightweight.
Whenever the engineer works overtime, then if it is not the case that consuming a snack leads to the researcher not being distracted, the analysis is delayed.
The engineer works overtime, or the technician works overtime.

Provided that the manager notifies the engineer, then if the technician works overtime, the situation where consuming a snack does not result in the researcher being undistracted leads to the analysis being delayed.

If the manager notifies the technician, then when the technician works overtime, the circumstance that consuming a snack does not entail the researcher being undistracted results in the analysis being delayed.
Should the laptop have a screen issue, then the smartphone does not have a battery issue.
Given that the engineer receives a notification, the manager notifies the engineer.
Whenever the technician receives a notification, the manager notifies the technician.
If the deadline is urgent, then either the engineer receives a notification or the technician receives a notification.
Assuming the laptop is repaired, the laptop has a screen issue.
In the case that the smartphone is repaired, the laptop is repaired.
Either the task is completed, or if it is not the case that assigning a task by the manager implies that a lack of funding leads to the smartphone being repaired, then the task is delegated.
If the report is reviewed, then either the safety check passes or the project is funded.
The report is submitted, or the report is reviewed.
Whenever the technician tests the smartphone, then if the project is not funded, the laptop has a screen issue.
Either the technician tests the smartphone, or the technician tests the laptop.
Under the condition that the prototype uses alloy, the material is not lightweight.
Either the prototype uses alloy, or the prototype is not approved.
The prototype uses plastic, or the prototype does not use alloy.
Should it not be the case that the technician testing the laptop entails that a lack of funding results in the laptop having a screen issue, the prototype is approved.
Under the condition that it is not true that the technician performing the safety check leads to either the safety check passing or the project being funded, the failure is logged.
If it is not the case that the technician performing the safety check results in either the safety check passing or the project being funded, then the failure is not documented.
Whenever the project is not funded, the smartphone has a battery issue.

facts.natural: The technician performs the safety check.
The prototype does not use plastic.
The safety check does not pass.

The project is funded.

(A11 → A10).natural: If the failure is logged, then it is documented.

(A13 → A14).natural: Provided that the researcher consumes a snack, the researcher becomes distracted.

(A13 → ¬A14).natural: Under the condition that the researcher consumes a snack, it is not the case that the researcher is distracted.

(A13 ∨ (A6 → A12)).natural: Either the researcher consumes a snack, or if the prototype uses alloy, the material is lightweight.

(A16 → (¬(A13 → ¬A14) → A15)).natural: Whenever the engineer works overtime, then if it is not the case that consuming a snack leads to the researcher not being distracted, the analysis is delayed.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: The engineer works overtime, or the technician works overtime.

(A17 → (¬(A13 → ¬A14) → A15)).natural: In the event that the technician works overtime, then if it is not the case that consuming a snack implies the researcher is not distracted, the analysis is delayed.

(A18 → (A17 → (¬(A13 → ¬A14) → A15))).natural: Provided that the manager notifies the engineer, then if the technician works overtime, the situation where consuming a snack does not result in the researcher being undistracted leads to the analysis being delayed.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either the manager notifies the engineer, or the manager notifies the technician.

(A19 → (A17 → (¬(A13 → ¬A14) → A15))).natural: If the manager notifies the technician, then when the technician works overtime, the circumstance that consuming a snack does not entail the researcher being undistracted results in the analysis being delayed.

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: Should the laptop have a screen issue, then the smartphone does not have a battery issue.

(A20 → A18).natural: Given that the engineer receives a notification, the manager notifies the engineer.

(A20 ∨ A21).natural: The engineer receives a notification, or the technician receives a notification.

(A21 → A19).natural: Whenever the technician receives a notification, the manager notifies the technician.

(A22 → (A20 ∨ A21)).natural: If the deadline is urgent, then either the engineer receives a notification or the technician receives a notification.

(A23 → A2).natural: Assuming the laptop is repaired, the laptop has a screen issue.

(A24 → A23).natural: In the case that the smartphone is repaired, the laptop is repaired.

(A25 → (¬G → A24)).natural: Provided that the manager assigns a task, then if the project is not funded, the smartphone is repaired.

(A27 ∨ (¬(A25 → (¬G → A24)) → A26)).natural: Either the task is completed, or if it is not the case that assigning a task by the manager implies that a lack of funding leads to the smartphone being repaired, then the task is delegated.

(A28 → (A8 ∨ G)).natural: If the report is reviewed, then either the safety check passes or the project is funded.

(A29 ∨ A28).natural: The report is submitted, or the report is reviewed.

(A3 → (¬G → A2)).natural: Whenever the technician tests the smartphone, then if the project is not funded, the laptop has a screen issue.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the technician tests the smartphone, or the technician tests the laptop.

(A4 → (¬G → A2)).natural: In the event that the technician tests the laptop, then should the project not be funded, the laptop has a screen issue.

(A6 → A12).natural: Provided that the prototype uses alloy, the material is lightweight.

(A6 → ¬A12).natural: Under the condition that the prototype uses alloy, the material is not lightweight.

(A6 ∨ ¬A5).natural: Either the prototype uses alloy, or the prototype is not approved.

(A7 ∨ ¬A6).natural: The prototype uses plastic, or the prototype does not use alloy.

(A8 ∨ G).natural: The safety check passes, or the project is funded.

(A9 → (A8 ∨ G)).natural: If the technician performs the safety check, then either the safety check passes or the project is funded.

(¬(A13 → ¬A14) → A15).natural: Whenever it is not the case that consuming a snack leads to the researcher not being distracted, the analysis is delayed.

(¬(A25 → (¬G → A24)) → A26).natural: In the case that it is not true that assigning a task by the manager implies that if the project is not funded then the smartphone is repaired, the task is delegated.

(¬(A4 → (¬G → A2)) → A5).natural: Should it not be the case that the technician testing the laptop entails that a lack of funding results in the laptop having a screen issue, the prototype is approved.

(¬(A9 → (A8 ∨ G)) → A10).natural: Provided that it is false that the technician performing the safety check implies that either the safety check passes or the project is funded, the failure is documented.

(¬(A9 → (A8 ∨ G)) → A11).natural: Under the condition that it is not true that the technician performing the safety check leads to either the safety check passing or the project being funded, the failure is logged.

(¬(A9 → (A8 ∨ G)) → ¬A10).natural: If it is not the case that the technician performing the safety check results in either the safety check passing or the project being funded, then the failure is not documented.

(¬G → A1).natural: Whenever the project is not funded, the smartphone has a battery issue.

(¬G → A2).natural: In the event that the project is not funded, the laptop has a screen issue.

(¬G → A23).natural: Given that the project is not funded, the laptop is repaired.

(¬G → A24).natural: Should the project not be funded, the smartphone is repaired.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: Provided that the project is not funded, the smartphone does not have a battery issue.

A9.natural: The technician performs the safety check.

¬A13.natural: The researcher does not consume a snack.

¬A6.natural: The prototype does not use alloy.

¬A7.natural: The prototype does not use plastic.

¬A8.natural: The safety check does not pass.
